articles.headline: Databases highlight tired truckers
articles.summary: An investigation into fatigue among truckers revealed that long hours contributed to hundreds of deaths annually. The data analysis involved compiling several databases, which were missing critical information.

articles.headline: SPOTLIGHT: NICAR IN PHILADELPHIA A conference report
articles.author_title: Missouri School of Journalism and NICAR
articles.summary: Over 400 journalists attended the NICAR conference in Philadelphia, networking and learning new computer-assisted reporting skills despite budget cuts in training across newsrooms.

articles.headline: Databases add depth to pool stories
articles.summary: Reporters can enhance stories on pool safety using data from the Consumer Product Safety Commission to uncover detailed safety issues and fatalities related to consumer products

articles.headline: Tracking donors in city hall
articles.summary: The article discusses methods for tracking campaign contributions in local government, emphasizing the importance of monitoring political donors to understand financial influences.
